Jonathan McGlone
University of Michigan Libraries
 Michigan Publishing
 839 Greene St 1210 Buhr Bldg
Ann Arbor MI 48104-3209
P: (734) 763-4260
ude.hcimu@enolgcmj

Academic librarian engaged in front end development, user interface design, accessibility + usability, and digital publishing workflows for academic publishers committed to open access. Keen to support emerging and non-traditional publishing models and technologies that advance scholarly publishing's transformation. Currently serving as managing editor of the Journal of Electronic Publishing.

Degrees

MLIS, Wayne State University, Detroit, MI, 2008
Open Access Journals: Towards a Digital Commons for Scholarly Communication

BA, Communications & Film Studies, Calvin College, Grand Rapids, MI, 2005

Professional Employment

Front End Developer & UI Designer, Michigan Publishing, University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, 2013-present

  • Lead front end development, UI design, usability, and accessibility for over 50 web assets including open access journals, monographs and websites hosted on a variety of platforms with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Led the design and development for Michigan Publishing's consolidated branding, including wireframes, responsive web design, and WCAG compliance.
  • Lead UX, UI design, and front-end development for a Mellon-funded open-source platform that will enable the publication and preservation of digitally enriched humanities monographs. The platform will enable digital publishing fully-encoded XML in Hydra powered Fedora repositories.
  • Develop scripts and improve workflows for converting and publishing content in specific XML schemas.

Digital Publishing Project Manager, Michigan Publishing, University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, 2012-2013

  • Project manager for the development, creation, and management of the NEH, CDC, and Robert Wood Johnson Foundation funded The American Influenza Epidemic of 1918-1919: A Digital Encyclopedia. The project consists of a collection of over 16,000 freely available historical documents and photographs complemented with essays exploring how various U.S. cities reacted to the 1918 influenza epidemic.
  • Managed the web conversion and publication processes for a stable of open access journals published and hosted by Michigan Publishing.
  • Developed scripts and improved workflows for converting and publishing content in specific XML schemas.

Scholarly Communications Librarian, Wayne State University Library System, Wayne State University, Detroit, 2010-2012

  • Project manager for Wayne State University Institutional Repository and activities; provided the strategic planning, day-to-day management, staff/department education, marketing and promotion for WSU’s institutional repository.
  • Collaborated with WSU Press to plan, implement, and manage online subscription based journals program; managed and developed back-end work flow to migrate 6 peer-reviewed journals to Digital Commons; created workshops and training for editorial staff; developed digital publishing internship.
  • Created and led the WSU Scholarly Communications Team, managing projects, outreach, marketing, and other scholarly communications initiatives; coordinated and led first WSU Open Access Week.
  • Researched, planned, implemented, and manage open access theses and dissertations program; copyright and permissions management; collaboration with Graduate School, ProQuest, and library departments; established data transformation workflows, involving XSLT transformations of XML.
  • Researched, planned, implemented, and manage faculty self-archiving program; developed workflows and services to handle permissions and rights clearance, document reformatting, and publication deposits to Digital Commons for faculty and staff; hired, trained, and supervised two undergraduate and two graduate interns; developed workshops on self-archiving and author’s rights for librarians, faculty, and graduate students.

Digital Projects Librarian, Wayne State University Library System, Wayne State University, 2008-2010

  • Managed digital collection of over 300,000 digital images, developing web-services to improve access and usability.
  • Collaborated with the Smithsonian’s Freer Sackler Gallery, developing and implementing a digital project that brought the Peacock Room and its collection to a digital environment.
  • Project manager for NEH funded grant to build presentation tools for digital collection software.
  • Assisted in the development and maintenance of Wayne State University Library’s website, including a large-scale project to assess, re-design, build, and implement a new library website.
  • Project manager for Wayne State University Institutional Repository and activities; provided the strategic planning, day-to-day management, staff/department education, marketing and promotion for WSU’s institutional repository.

Freelance Web Developer, 2005-present

Providing small-scale web design, development, and consulting services for publishers, academic digital humanities projects, and other digital publishing ventures.

Technology Applications and Expertise

Specialized Skills
User Interface Design, Usability Testing, Front-End Web Development, Web Design, Web Analytics, Digital Publishing Workflows, Digital Preservation
Markup/Programming
XTHML, HTML5, CSS, CSS3, JavaScript, XML, XSLT, PHP, Perl, Ruby, MySQL
Publishing Platforms
WordPress, Drupal, DLXS, Hydra/Fedora, Digital Commons
Applications
Adobe Creative Suite, Filemaker Pro, Oxygen, Microsoft Office, Google Drive
OS/Environments
Mac, Linux, Unix, Ubuntu, Windows

Presentations and Publications

Ann Arbor, MI. Invited Co-Presenter. Rackham Graduate School, "Building a Professional Presence Online," March 2015. Presented with Meredith Kahn.

Ann Arbor, MI. Invited Panelist. Interdisciplinary Committee on Organizational Studies (ICOS), University of Michigan, "Toward an Open Science Framework: Finding Common Ground for Researchers, Developers, and Publishers," November 2014.

Atlanta, GA. Conference Co-Presenter. Library Information and Technology Association (LITA) National Conference. “DLO to Go: Fostering Instructional Use of New Media,” October 2010. Presented with Nardina N. Mein and Joshua Neds-Fox.
